title: Hack'EM strategy guide for vanilla players
data:
This guide is meant as a introductionary strategy guide for vanilla players so it won't have basic Nethack tips. It will focus on changes from vanilla and strategy tips that are not in vanilla.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Techniques](#Techniques)

- [2 Shop services](#Shop_services)

- [3 Elbereth](#Elbereth)

- [4 In game dictionary](#In_game_dictionary)

- [5 Monsters](#Monsters)

  - [5.1 Zombies](#Zombies)
  - [5.2 Locusts](#Locusts)
  - [5.3 Mummies](#Mummies)
  - [5.4 Dwarves](#Dwarves)
  - [5.5 Dragons](#Dragons)
  - [5.6 Mind flayers](#Mind_flayers)
  - [5.7 Ferns](#Ferns)

- [6 Sokoban](#Sokoban)

- [7 Containers](#Containers)

  - [8.2 Scroll of cloning](#Scroll_of_cloning)

- [9 Credit cloning](#Credit_cloning)

- [10 Wishes](#Wishes)

  - [10.1 Magic Resistance](#Magic_Resistance)
  - [10.2 Reflection](#Reflection)
  - [10.3 Speed](#Speed)
  - [10.4 Drain Resistance](#Drain_Resistance)
  - [10.5 Sonic Resistance](#Sonic_Resistance)

  - [10.8 Potions](#Potions)

- [11 Forging](#Forging)

- [13 Armor/weapons getting destroyed by rust/corrosion](#Armor.2Fweapons_getting_destroyed_by_rust.2Fcorrosion)

- [14 Gray stones and identification of gray stones](#Gray_stones_and_identification_of_gray_stones)

- [15 Flanking mechanic](#Flanking_mechanic)

- [16 Doppelganger polyself strategies](#Doppelganger_polyself_strategies)

  - [16.1 Egg laying strategy (footrice)](#Egg_laying_strategy_.28footrice.29)
  - [16.2 Polymorphing into poison resistant monsters to eat poisonous corpses](#Polymorphing_into_poison_resistant_monsters_to_eat_poisonous_corpses)

- [17 Polypiling strats](#Polypiling_strats)

- [18 Upgrading items](#Upgrading_items)

- [22 Robbing black market](#Robbing_black_market)

- [23 Pets](#Pets)

  - [23.1 #loot](#.23loot)
  - [23.2 Dagul figurine](#Dagul_figurine)
  - [23.3 Planetar figurine](#Planetar_figurine)
  - [23.4 Deity minions](#Deity_minions)

- [24 Necromancer strategy](#Necromancer_strategy)

## Techniques

Don't forget to use #tech. They can help you out of a lot of bad situations.

## Shop services

Shops in Hack'EM some times offer services. To use those press p when not carrying shop items to see what services are offered.

## Elbereth

Elbereth can not be used until the player has learnt about it. This can be done in the prize tile of sokoban, fortune cookies or rumours from the oracle. Elves and hobbits start with the knowledge of Elbereth. Orcs can never use Elbereth.

## In game dictionary

Hack'EM contains an in game dictionary that tries to give as much information as possible on monsters and items. To access on a monster/item on screen ; followed by : when a tile is selected. It can also be accessed from inventory by selecting an item. To search for a item/monster not in inventory or screen can be done using /? .

## Monsters

### Zombies

The zombies in Hack'EM are the same kind of zombies as in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). This means that zombies can attack and eat your brain making you lose Int and cause amnesia. The probability of this happening from a zombie attack can be reduced by using a helmet. Zombies can also cause TermIll with their attack. The TermIll can also insta-kill your pets. Zombies are best handled with ranged attacks.

### Locusts

Be VERY careful about locusts since they can cause TermIll.

### Mummies

Hack'EM has taken the mummy implementation from [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") so mummies can cause a "Wither" status which does damage over time. The strength of the withering depends on the mummy type and can cause considerable damage.

### Dwarves

Dwarves tend to carry !oBooze so if you happen to find a lot of base $50 potions from dwarves it is most likely booze. These potions can be used to counteract fear.

### Dragons

Add text about passives and armor

### Mind flayers

Add text about =oFA

### Ferns

Add text about infestations

### Shambling horrors

## Sokoban

Add text about usage of !oObjectDetection and prices

## Containers

Dropping a container on altars will BUC id the content of that container. For identified containers and wands of cancellation Hack'EM prevents you from putting a wand of cancellation into a bag of holding. It is still possible if you put a wand in a sack and then put that sack in a bag of holding.

## Scrolls

### Scroll of knowledge

Hack'EM adds a new base $50 scroll called "scroll of knowledge" (that Arc also start with). These scrolls ask for what type of item you want to identify and will identify those items in your game. This can be useful to identify scrolls/spellbook to be able to write those. FIXME: Add text on suggested useful items to identify.

### Scroll of cloning

## Credit cloning

Items made of dragonhide are very valuable. Selling and stealing those items using a pet can be very useful.

## Wishes

Hack'EM allows up to two artifact wishes that are guaranteed to be successful allowing more flexibility for artifact wishing in order to fill in parts of an ascension kit. Note that [potions of gain level](/wiki/Potions_of_gain_level "Potions of gain level") and the #tinker technique can be used to create powerful items without having to spend a wish on them.

### Magic Resistance

- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance")
- [amulet of magic resistance](/wiki/Amulet_of_magic_resistance "Amulet of magic resistance")
- [The Ring of P'hul](/wiki/The_Ring_of_P%27hul "The Ring of P'hul")
- [Treasury of Proteus](/wiki/Treasury_of_Proteus "Treasury of Proteus")
- [Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "Eye of the Aethiopica")
- [Platinum Yendorian Express Card](/wiki/Platinum_Yendorian_Express_Card "Platinum Yendorian Express Card")
- [Crown of Saint Edward](/wiki/Crown_of_Saint_Edward "Crown of Saint Edward")
- [gray dragon scales](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scales "Gray dragon scales")

### Reflection

Note that reflection no longer fully negates the effects of the attacks that it reflects

- [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection")
- [Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane "Dragonbane")
- [Itlachiayaque](/wiki/Itlachiayaque "Itlachiayaque")
- [Magic Mirror of Merlin](/wiki/Magic_Mirror_of_Merlin "Magic Mirror of Merlin")
- [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection")
- [silver dragon scales](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scales "Silver dragon scales")
- [spellbook of reflection](/index.php?title=Spellbook_of_reflection\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spellbook of reflection (page does not exist)")

### Speed

- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots")
- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [helm of speed](/wiki/Helm_of_speed "Helm of speed")
- [Helm of Hermes](/index.php?title=Helm_of_Hermes\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Helm of Hermes (page does not exist)")
- [blue dragon scales](/wiki/Blue_dragon_scales "Blue dragon scales")

### Drain Resistance

- [amulet of drain resistance](/wiki/Amulet_of_drain_resistance "Amulet of drain resistance")
- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [ruffled shirt](/wiki/Ruffled_shirt "Ruffled shirt") of [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance")
- [deep dragon scales](/wiki/Deep_dragon_scales "Deep dragon scales")
- [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur")/[Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer")/[Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/Staff_of_Aesculapius "Staff of Aesculapius")

### Sonic Resistance

- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [toque](/wiki/Toque "Toque")
- [ring of sonic resistance](/index.php?title=Ring_of_sonic_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ring of sonic resistance (page does not exist)")
- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [ruffled shirt](/wiki/Ruffled_shirt "Ruffled shirt") of [sonic resistance](/index.php?title=Sonic_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sonic resistance (page does not exist)")

### Psychic Resistance

- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [tinfoil hat](/wiki/Tinfoil_hat "Tinfoil hat")
- [ring of psychic resistance](/index.php?title=Ring_of_psychic_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ring of psychic resistance (page does not exist)")
- [keg](/index.php?title=Keg\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Keg (page does not exist)")

### Scrolls

- [scrolls of charging](/wiki/Scrolls_of_charging "Scrolls of charging")
- [scrolls of annihilation](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide")
- [scrolls of time](/wiki/Scroll_of_time "Scroll of time")
- [scrolls of transmogrify](/wiki/Scroll_of_transmogrify "Scroll of transmogrify")

### Potions

- [potions of invulnerability](/wiki/Potion_of_invulnerability "Potion of invulnerability")
- [potions of gain level](/wiki/Potions_of_gain_level "Potions of gain level")

### Weapons

- [Bat from Hell](/wiki/Bat_from_Hell "Bat from Hell")
- [The Lightsaber Prototype](/wiki/The_Lightsaber_Prototype "The Lightsaber Prototype")
- [Thunderstruck](/index.php?title=Thunderstruck\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Thunderstruck (page does not exist)")
- [Windrider](/index.php?title=Windrider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Windrider (page does not exist)")
- [Chains of Malcanthet](/index.php?title=Chains_of_Malcanthet\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Chains of Malcanthet (page does not exist)")
- [Reaper](/wiki/Reaper "Reaper")
- [Dramborleg](/wiki/Dramborleg "Dramborleg")
- [Hellfire](/wiki/Hellfire "Hellfire")/[Plague](/wiki/Plague "Plague")
- [Houchou](/wiki/Houchou "Houchou")

### Other Armor

- [crystal plate mail](/wiki/Crystal_plate_mail "Crystal plate mail")
- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [mana cloak](/wiki/Mana_cloak "Mana cloak")
- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [cloak of flight](/wiki/Cloak_of_flight "Cloak of flight")
- [shield of mobility](/wiki/Shield_of_mobility "Shield of mobility")
- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [gauntlets of swimming](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_swimming "Gauntlets of swimming")
- [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") [gauntlets of power](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_power "Gauntlets of power")
- [black dragon scales](/wiki/Black_dragon_scales "Black dragon scales")
- [sea dragon scales](/index.php?title=Sea_dragon_scales\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sea dragon scales (page does not exist)")

### Tools

- [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")
- [Wallet of Perseus](/wiki/Wallet_of_Perseus "Wallet of Perseus")
- [Gjallar](/index.php?title=Gjallar\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gjallar (page does not exist)")
- [mask](/index.php?title=Mask\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mask (page does not exist)")
- [magic candles](/wiki/Magic_candle "Magic candle")

## Polypiling strats

You can not polypile unicorn horns to magic markers. FIXME: polypiling strats

## Upgrading items

FIXME: Text about tinker and !oGL.

## Sonic and psychic resistance

## Safe and crystal chest cracking/opening

## Woolly mammoth/Serpopard rain

A possible strategy for the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") known as "woolly rain" involves using a [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") to generate woolly mammoths, then using them to clear out various monsters, similar to the "purple rain" strategy involving [purple worms](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm"). This strategy was first used in Evilhack. In Hack'EM the Serpopard is an interesting alternative to use for the "rain" strategy. Make sure to drop a scroll of scare monster first before summoning them, otherwise they might overwhelm you before you can tame them.

## Robbing black market

## Pets

### #loot

You can manage pets inventories using #loot. With this you can take items and give items to your pet. This can also help with stealing items from a store, but be careful. As always, you can safely pick up anything your pet drops on the special square just inside the doorway. If you or your pet is on that square, however, anything you loot from your pet still belongs to the shop. The only safe times to take "stolen" goods from your pet are when you are outside the shop and your pet is in the doorway, or you are in the doorway and the pet is outside, or you are both outside.

### Dagul figurine

### Planetar figurine

There is a chance for a planetar figurine on Ruggo's level.

### Deity minions

## Necromancer strategy
html:
Hack'EM strategy guide for vanilla players

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

This guide is meant as a introductionary strategy guide for vanilla players so it won't have basic Nethack tips. It will focus on changes from vanilla and strategy tips that are not in vanilla.

Contents

  • 1 Techniques
  • 2 Shop services
  • 3 Elbereth
  • 4 In game dictionary
  • 5 Monsters
    • 5.1 Zombies
    • 5.2 Locusts
    • 5.3 Mummies
    • 5.4 Dwarves
    • 5.5 Dragons
    • 5.6 Mind flayers
    • 5.7 Ferns
    • 5.8 Shambling horrors
  • 6 Sokoban
  • 7 Containers
  • 8 Scrolls
    • 8.1 Scroll of knowledge
    • 8.2 Scroll of cloning
  • 9 Credit cloning
  • 10 Wishes
    • 10.1 Magic Resistance
    • 10.2 Reflection
    • 10.3 Speed
    • 10.4 Drain Resistance
    • 10.5 Sonic Resistance
    • 10.6 Psychic Resistance
    • 10.7 Scrolls
    • 10.8 Potions
    • 10.9 Weapons
    • 10.10 Other Armor
    • 10.11 Tools
  • 11 Forging
  • 12 Dual wielding artifacts
  • 13 Armor/weapons getting destroyed by rust/corrosion
  • 14 Gray stones and identification of gray stones
  • 15 Flanking mechanic
  • 16 Doppelganger polyself strategies
    • 16.1 Egg laying strategy (footrice)
    • 16.2 Polymorphing into poison resistant monsters to eat poisonous corpses
  • 17 Polypiling strats
  • 18 Upgrading items
  • 19 Sonic and psychic resistance
  • 20 Safe and crystal chest cracking/opening
  • 21 Woolly mammoth/Serpopard rain
  • 22 Robbing black market
  • 23 Pets
    • 23.1 #loot
    • 23.2 Dagul figurine
    • 23.3 Planetar figurine
    • 23.4 Deity minions
  • 24 Necromancer strategy

Techniques

Don't forget to use #tech. They can help you out of a lot of bad situations.

Shop services

Shops in Hack'EM some times offer services. To use those press p when not carrying shop items to see what services are offered.

Elbereth

Elbereth can not be used until the player has learnt about it. This can be done in the prize tile of sokoban, fortune cookies or rumours from the oracle. Elves and hobbits start with the knowledge of Elbereth. Orcs can never use Elbereth.

In game dictionary

Hack'EM contains an in game dictionary that tries to give as much information as possible on monsters and items. To access on a monster/item on screen ; followed by : when a tile is selected. It can also be accessed from inventory by selecting an item. To search for a item/monster not in inventory or screen can be done using /? .

Monsters

Zombies

The zombies in Hack'EM are the same kind of zombies as in EvilHack. This means that zombies can attack and eat your brain making you lose Int and cause amnesia. The probability of this happening from a zombie attack can be reduced by using a helmet. Zombies can also cause TermIll with their attack. The TermIll can also insta-kill your pets. Zombies are best handled with ranged attacks.

Locusts

Be VERY careful about locusts since they can cause TermIll.

Mummies

Hack'EM has taken the mummy implementation from EvilHack so mummies can cause a "Wither" status which does damage over time. The strength of the withering depends on the mummy type and can cause considerable damage.

Dwarves

Dwarves tend to carry !oBooze so if you happen to find a lot of base $50 potions from dwarves it is most likely booze. These potions can be used to counteract fear.

Dragons

Add text about passives and armor

Mind flayers

Add text about =oFA

Ferns

Add text about infestations

Shambling horrors

Sokoban

Add text about usage of !oObjectDetection and prices

Containers

Dropping a container on altars will BUC id the content of that container. For identified containers and wands of cancellation Hack'EM prevents you from putting a wand of cancellation into a bag of holding. It is still possible if you put a wand in a sack and then put that sack in a bag of holding.

Scrolls

Scroll of knowledge

Hack'EM adds a new base $50 scroll called "scroll of knowledge" (that Arc also start with). These scrolls ask for what type of item you want to identify and will identify those items in your game. This can be useful to identify scrolls/spellbook to be able to write those. FIXME: Add text on suggested useful items to identify.

Scroll of cloning

Credit cloning

Items made of dragonhide are very valuable. Selling and stealing those items using a pet can be very useful.

Wishes

Hack'EM allows up to two artifact wishes that are guaranteed to be successful allowing more flexibility for artifact wishing in order to fill in parts of an ascension kit. Note that potions of gain level and the #tinker technique can be used to create powerful items without having to spend a wish on them.

Magic Resistance

  • dragonhide cloak of magic resistance
  • amulet of magic resistance
  • The Ring of P'hul
  • Treasury of Proteus
  • Eye of the Aethiopica
  • Platinum Yendorian Express Card
  • Crown of Saint Edward
  • gray dragon scales

Reflection

Note that reflection no longer fully negates the effects of the attacks that it reflects

  • shield of reflection
  • Dragonbane
  • Itlachiayaque
  • Magic Mirror of Merlin
  • amulet of reflection
  • silver dragon scales

Speed

  • dragonhide speed boots
  • dragonhide helm of speed

  • blue dragon scales

Drain Resistance

  • amulet of drain resistance
  • dragonhide ruffled shirt of drain resistance
  • deep dragon scales

Sonic Resistance

  • dragonhide toque

Psychic Resistance

  • dragonhide tinfoil hat

  • keg

Scrolls

  • scrolls of charging
  • scrolls of annihilation
  • scrolls of time
  • scrolls of transmogrify

Potions

  • potions of invulnerability
  • potions of gain level

Weapons

  • Bat from Hell
  • The Lightsaber Prototype
  • Thunderstruck
  • Windrider
  • Chains of Malcanthet
  • Reaper
  • Dramborleg
  • Hellfire/Plague
  • Houchou

Other Armor

  • crystal plate mail
  • dragonhide mana cloak
  • dragonhide cloak of flight
  • shield of mobility
  • dragonhide gauntlets of swimming
  • dragonhide gauntlets of power
  • black dragon scales
  • sea dragon scales

Tools

  • magic marker
  • Wallet of Perseus
  • Gjallar
  • mask
  • magic candles

Woolly mammoth/Serpopard rain

A possible strategy for the Astral Plane known as "woolly rain" involves using a cursed scroll of genocide to generate woolly mammoths, then using them to clear out various monsters, similar to the "purple rain" strategy involving purple worms. This strategy was first used in Evilhack. In Hack'EM the Serpopard is an interesting alternative to use for the "rain" strategy. Make sure to drop a scroll of scare monster first before summoning them, otherwise they might overwhelm you before you can tame them.

Robbing black market

Pets

#loot

You can manage pets inventories using #loot. With this you can take items and give items to your pet. This can also help with stealing items from a store, but be careful. As always, you can safely pick up anything your pet drops on the special square just inside the doorway. If you or your pet is on that square, however, anything you loot from your pet still belongs to the shop. The only safe times to take "stolen" goods from your pet are when you are outside the shop and your pet is in the doorway, or you are in the doorway and the pet is outside, or you are both outside.

Dagul figurine

Planetar figurine

There is a chance for a planetar figurine on Ruggo's level.

It will focus on changes from vanilla and strategy tips that are not in vanilla.

== Safe and crystal chest cracking/opening ==
== Woolly mammoth/Serpopard rain ==
A possible strategy for the [[Astral Plane]] known as "woolly rain" involves using a [[cursed]] [[scroll of genocide]] to generate woolly mammoths, then using them to clear out various monsters, similar to the "purple rain" strategy involving [[purple worm]]s. This strategy was first used in Evilhack. In Hack'EM the Serpopard is an interesting alternative to use for the "rain" strategy. Make sure to drop a scroll of scare monster first before summoning them, otherwise they might overwhelm you before you can tame them.

== Robbing black market ==

== Pets ==
=== #loot ===
You can manage pets inventories using #loot. With this you can take items and give items to your pet.
This can also help with stealing items from a store, but be careful. As always, you can safely pick up anything your pet drops on the special square just inside the doorway. If you or your pet is on that square, however, anything you loot from your pet still belongs to the shop. The only safe times to take "stolen" goods from your pet are when you are outside the shop and your pet is in the doorway, or you are in the doorway and the pet is outside, or you are both outside.
